fields.headline: Snow update
fields.bodyText: Snow of the week The majority of resorts in the Italian and southern French Alps felt the sweet kiss of snowfall last weekend, which allowed a few days' powder skiing. Both Tignes, with a lower slope depth of 50cm and upper of 140cm, and Val d'Isère, 90cm lower and 140cm upper, have excellent skiing as a result. Barèges in the Pyrenees had three days of snowfall early last week and has depths of 70cm low down and 130cm up above. Sauze d'Oulx in Italy had over a metre of snow in just two days. Across the pond, California has received the greatest quantity, resulting in excellent conditions. There's nothing woolly about the slopes at Mammoth with 210cm of consolidated snow depth on the lower slopes and 240cm on the uppers and it's been falling like manna at Heavenly, with a lower depth of 125cm and upper of 200cm. Colorado has had substantial falls (averaging 25cm), Utah resorts have had a dusting of fresh snow and Canada has enjoyed a glistening combination of sunlight and snowfall. Deal of the week Crystal Holidays (0870 8487000) is offering seven nights' self-catering accommodation in Chamonix, France, including return flights and transfers from Manchester, Birmingham or Bristol on 16 March, for £199 per person. Website of the week Does one or two weeks on the slopes whet your appetite for more? Then check out www.planetsubzero.com, the website for those considering spending an entire season up a French mountain. Planet Subzero offers long-stay accommodation in chalets in Les Arcs, Chamonix or Tignes, with prices starting at £2,150 for five months.
